items.name: Ext.grid.CellContext
items.text: Instances of this class encapsulate a position in a grid's row/column coordinate system. Cells are addressed using the owning record and column for robustness. the column may be moved, the store may be sorted, and the CellContext will still reference the same *logical* cell. Be aware that due to buffered rendering the *physical* cell may not exist. The setPosition method however allows a numeric row and column to be passed in. These are immediately converted. Be careful not to make `CellContext` objects *too* persistent. If the owning record is removed, or the owning column is removed, the reference will be stale. Freshly created context objects, such as those exposed by events from the {Ext.grid.selection.SpreadsheetModel spreadsheet selection model} are safe to use until your application mutates the store, or changes the column set.

items.name: constructor
items.text: Creates a new CellContext which references a Ext.view.Table

items.name: view
items.text: The Ext.view.Table for which the cell context is needed. To complete creation of a valid context, use the setPosition method.

items.name: setPosition
items.text: Binds this cell context to a logical cell defined by the record and column.

items.name: row
items.text: The row index or record which owns the required cell.

items.name: col
items.text: The column index (In the owning View's leaf column set), or the owning Ext.grid.column.Column. A one argument form may be used in the form of an array: [column, row] Or another CellContext may be passed.
this CellContext object.

items.name: getCell
items.text:
Returns the cell object referenced *at the time of calling*. Note that grid DOM is transient, and
the cell referenced may be removed from the DOM due to paging or buffered rendering or column or record removal.

items.name: returnDom
items.text: Pass `true` to return a DOM object instead of an {@link Ext.dom.Element Element).
The cell referenced by this context.

items.name: getRow
items.text:
Returns the row object referenced *at the time of calling*. Note that grid DOM is transient, and
the row referenced may be removed from the DOM due to paging or buffered rendering or column or record removal.

items.name: returnDom
items.text: Pass `true` to return a DOM object instead of an {@link Ext.dom.Element Element).
The grid row referenced by this context.

items.name: getNode
items.text:
Returns the view node object (the encapsulating element of a data row) referenced *at the time of
calling*. Note that grid DOM is transient, and the node referenced may be removed from the DOM due
to paging or buffered rendering or column or record removal.

items.name: returnDom
items.text: Pass `true` to return a DOM object instead of an {@link Ext.dom.Element Element).
The grid item referenced by this context.

items.name: isEqual
items.text: Compares this CellContext object to another CellContext to see if they refer to the same cell.

items.name: other
items.text: The CellContext to compare.
`true` if the other cell context references the same cell as this.

items.name: clone
items.text:
Creates a clone of this CellContext.

The clone may be retargeted without affecting the reference of this context.
A copy of this context, referencing the same cell.

items.name: navigate
items.text: Navigates left or right within the current row.

items.name: direction
items.text: `-1` to go towards the row start or `1` to go towards row end

items.name: isCellContext
items.text: `true` in this class to identify an object as an instantiated CellContext, or subclass thereof.

items.name: column
items.text: The grid column which owns the referenced cell.

items.name: record
items.text: The store record which maps to the referenced cell.

items.name: rowIdx
items.text: The row number in the store which owns the referenced cell. *Be aware that after the initial call to setPosition, this value may become stale due to subsequent store mutation.*

items.name: colIdx
items.text: The column index in the owning View's leaf column set of the referenced cell. *Be aware that after the initial call to setPosition, this value may become stale due to subsequent column mutation.*
